channel.title: Comments for Thresholds
channel.description: Poets in residence at the University of Cambridge museums and collections.

item.title: Comment on Welcome to Thresholds by Selena Yuan

item.description: It would be nice to publish an anthology of all the poems!
item.content:encoded: It would be nice to publish an anthology of all the poems!

item.description: Very good and fresh movies. Congratulations!

item.title: Comment on Live stream by Malcolm Dale
item.dc:creator: Malcolm Dale
item.description: Helen/Rachel Have watched the Livestream again and enjoyed it even more. My earlier comment about the camera angle was a fault on my computer and not yours.How I wish I could have been there! Malcolm Dale
item.content:encoded:
Helen/Rachel
Have watched the Livestream again and enjoyed it even more. My earlier comment about the camera angle was a fault on my computer and not yours.How I wish I could have been there!
Malcolm Dale

item.title: Comment on Live stream by Anna de Bruyckere
item.dc:creator: Anna de Bruyckere
item.description: Thank you very much for the wonderful end event to the Thresholds project. Hearing all ten poems on the site of the conception of one of them, and listening to all warm words of the speakers, each loving poetry in their own way, made for a memorable finale. I am all the more curious about next editions now!
item.content:encoded: Thank you very much for the wonderful end event to the Thresholds project. Hearing all ten poems on the site of the conception of one of them, and listening to all warm words of the speakers, each loving poetry in their own way, made for a memorable finale. I am all the more curious about next editions now!

item.title: Comment on Live stream by Malcolm Dale
item.dc:creator: Malcolm Dale
item.description: Rachel/Helen Have just watched the Livestream---brilliant idea! (camera perhaps not quite adjusted?) So sorry not to have been there. Sadly I missed the film. Presumably I can recall it? Obviously this project has proved to be utterly successful! What next?
item.content:encoded:
Rachel/Helen
Have just watched the Livestream—brilliant idea! (camera perhaps not quite adjusted?) So sorry not to have been there.
Sadly I missed the film. Presumably I can recall it? Obviously this project has proved to be utterly successful! What next?

item.title: Comment on Gillian Clarke’s reading and the Better-Late-Than-Never-Discoverer by Marie-Anne Rodolakis
item.dc:creator: Marie-Anne Rodolakis
item.description: Anne Murray’s inspired writing made me feel part of the event even though I wasn’t there… It also prompted me to find out more about Thresholds and Cambridge’s hidden treasures ! Thank you...
item.content:encoded:
Anne Murray’s inspired writing made me feel part of the event even though I wasn’t there…
It also prompted me to find out more about Thresholds and Cambridge’s hidden treasures !
Thank you…

item.description: [...] My Museum Experience “My visit was like a conversation with these inanimate objects which animated the past before my eyes.” Kruti Jethwa, a student at Manor School, describes her experience at the Sedgwick Museum during a Thresholds workshop. Read updates from the project on the Thresholds blog. [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] My Museum Experience “My visit was like a conversation with these inanimate objects which animated the past before my eyes.” Kruti Jethwa, a student at Manor School, describes her experience at the Sedgwick Museum during a Thresholds workshop. Read updates from the project on the Thresholds blog. [...]

item.title: Comment on Gillian Clarke’s reading and the Better-Late-Than-Never-Discoverer by Isaac Swirsky
item.dc:creator: Isaac Swirsky
item.description: Thank you Anne Murrey for this wonderful blog. I'll be sure to check out the threshold festival.
item.content:encoded: Thank you Anne Murrey for this wonderful blog. I’ll be sure to check out the threshold festival.

item.title: Comment on How Are We Beguiled by Anastasia Bow-Bertrand
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Bow-Bertrand
item.description: It is only recently that I have discovered Cambridge ‘proper’. Aside from the array of student societies are the offerings of a dynamic, cultural City. These have been the highlights of my past term, affording the brightest mix of people, histories and backgrounds. Through the wonderful Thresholds initiative, my term has been marked by a poetry workshop in the Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology with Daljit Nagra. The project, which celebrates ten poets in residence at the University of Cambridge Museums and Collections, regularly holds poetry readings. At a brilliantly energised recital by Gillian Clarke at the University Library, I sat next to a lady who by day is a waitress, and by night an avid reader, currently embarking on her first novel. Slowly, I am getting around the museums, reading, writing and listening as I go.
item.content:encoded:
It is only recently that I have discovered Cambridge ‘proper’. Aside from the array of student societies are the offerings of a dynamic, cultural City. These have been the highlights of my past term, affording the brightest mix of people, histories and backgrounds.
Through the wonderful Thresholds initiative, my term has been marked by a poetry workshop in the Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology with Daljit Nagra. The project, which celebrates ten poets in residence at the University of Cambridge Museums and Collections, regularly holds poetry readings. At a brilliantly energised recital by Gillian Clarke at the University Library, I sat next to a lady who by day is a waitress, and by night an avid reader, currently embarking on her first novel.
Slowly, I am getting around the museums, reading, writing and listening as I go.
